original_solution_mapping.L1: Cole has to pay 3 * 9 = $<<3*9=27>>27 for one side of the side fence.
original_solution_mapping.L2: For the shared left fence, he has to pay two-thirds of 27, so he has to pay 27 * 2 / 3 = $<<27*2/3=18>>18.
original_solution_mapping.L3: The shared back fence will cost 3 * 18 = $<<3*18=54>>54.
original_solution_mapping.L4: He has to pay for half the back fence, so it will cost 54 / 2 = $<<54/2=27>>27.
original_solution_mapping.L5: Thus, Cole has to pay 18 + 27 + 27 = $<<18+27+27=72>>72 for the fence.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 1385.
    Returns: the total amount Cole has to pay for the fence.
    """
    # L1
    fencing_cost_per_foot = 3 # Fencing costs $3 per foot
    side_length = 9 # 9 feet along the sides
    cost_one_side_fence = fencing_cost_per_foot * side_length

    # L2
    left_neighbor_numerator = 2 # a third of their shared side
    left_neighbor_denominator = 3 # a third of their shared side
    cost_shared_left_fence = cost_one_side_fence * left_neighbor_numerator / left_neighbor_denominator

    # L3
    back_length = 18 # 18 feet along the back
    cost_full_back_fence = fencing_cost_per_foot * back_length

    # L4
    back_fence_share_denominator = 2 # half of their shared side
    cost_cole_back_fence = cost_full_back_fence / back_fence_share_denominator

    # L5
    total_cost_cole = cost_shared_left_fence + cost_one_side_fence + cost_cole_back_fence

    # FA
    answer = total_cost_cole
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Cole has to pay {fencing_cost_per_foot} * {side_length} = $<<{fencing_cost_per_foot}*{side_length}={cost_one_side_fence}>>{cost_one_side_fence} for one side of the side fence.

For the shared left fence, he has to pay two-thirds of {cost_one_side_fence}, so he has to pay {cost_one_side_fence} * {left_neighbor_numerator} / {left_neighbor_denominator} = $<<{cost_one_side_fence}*{left_neighbor_numerator}/{left_neighbor_denominator}={cost_shared_left_fence}>>{cost_shared_left_fence}.
The shared back fence will cost {fencing_cost_per_foot} * {back_length} = $<<{fencing_cost_per_foot}*{back_length}={cost_full_back_fence}>>{cost_full_back_fence}.

He has to pay for half the back fence, so it will cost {cost_full_back_fence} / {back_fence_share_denominator} = $<<{cost_full_back_fence}/{back_fence_share_denominator}={cost_cole_back_fence}>>{cost_cole_back_fence}.

Thus, Cole has to pay {cost_shared_left_fence} + {cost_one_side_fence} + {cost_cole_back_fence} = $<<{cost_shared_left_fence}+{cost_one_side_fence}+{cost_cole_back_fence}={total_cost_cole}>>{total_cost_cole} for the fence.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: For the shared left fence, he has to pay two-thirds of 27, so he has to pay 27 * 2 / 3 = $<<27*2/3=18>>18.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: The shared back fence will cost 3 * 18 = $<<3*18=54>>54.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: He has to pay for half the back fence, so it will cost 54 / 18 = $<<54/18=3>>3.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: Thus, Cole has to pay 18 + 27 + 3 = $<<18+27+3=48>>48 for the fence.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'back_length' (18) was used instead of 'back_fence_share_denominator' (2).
